thread.title: Police called to Maradona's hotel after 'strong argument' | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Police called to Maradona's hotel after 'strong argument' | Daily Mail Online

author: Pete South For Mailonline
title: Police called to Maradona's hotel after 'strong argument' | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share They remained at the hotel for two hours and a complaint was not filed by either party. Maradona was also involved in an incident with COPE journalist Ángel García, who claimed the former Barcelona and Napoli star had attacked him while he tried to interview him. Rocio Oliva uploaded this image of the couple in Madrid on Tuesday at the hotel's spa Yesterday Ms. Oliva has uploaded a picture of the couple enjoying themselves at the hotel's spa along with the caption 'I love you, my love'. Real Madrid take on Napoli in the last 16 of the Champions League at the Bernabeu this evening. Maradona will be a guest at the game against the reigning European champions of Napoli president Aurelio de Laurentiis. Maradona was Napoli's biggest star in the late 1980s and early 90s, and played for the club when they met Madrid in the European Cup in 1987. Maradona won two league titles during his time with Napoli in the Eighties and Nighties The Spanish side won that game won 3-1 on aggregate. The Argentine and about 10,000 Napoli supporters made the trip to Madrid for what could be a historic moment for the club in Europe's top club competition. 'If I was a prophet, I wouldn't need to be a player,' Maradona said when asked about his prediction for the first leg as he arrived in the Spanish capital. Napoli have a chance to advance to the Champions League quarter-finals for the first time in its history. RELATED ARTICLES
